intro: Schizocarpum filiforme, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into schizocarps, which are dry fruits that split into separate parts upon maturity. Schizocarpum filiforme typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
